1.brief: a son (as a builder of the family name), in the widest sense (of literal and figurative relationship, including grandson, subject, nation, quality or condition, etc., (like father or brother), etc.)
properly, to hedge about (as with thorns), i.e. guard; generally, to protect, attend to, etc.
a command, whether human or divine (collectively, the Law)
to hide (by covering over); by implication, to hoard or reserve; figuratively to deny; specifically (favorably) to protect, (unfavorably) to lurk
properly, nearness (used only as a preposition or an adverb), near; hence, generally, with, by, at, among, etc.

2.brief: properly, to hedge about (as with thorns), i.e. guard; generally, to protect, attend to, etc.
a command, whether human or divine (collectively, the Law)
to live, whether literally or figuratively; causatively, to revive
a precept or statute, especially the Decalogue or Pentateuch
the little man of the eye; the pupil or ball; hence, the middle (of night)
an eye (literally or figuratively); by analogy, a fountain (as the eye of the landscape)

3.brief: to tie, physically (gird, confine, compact) or mentally (in love, league)
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
something to sieze with, i.e. a finger; by analogy, a toe
to grave, by implication, to write (describe, inscribe, prescribe, subscribe)
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
probably meaning to glisten; a tablet (as polished), of stone, wood or metal
the heart; also used (figuratively) very widely for the feelings, the will and even the intellect; likewise for the centre of anything

4.brief: a sister (used very widely (like brother), literally and figuratively)
thou and thee, or (plural) ye and you
to call out to (i.e. properly, address by name, but used in a wide variety of applications)

5.brief: properly, to hedge about (as with thorns), i.e. guard; generally, to protect, attend to, etc.
to turn aside (especially for lodging); hence to be aforeigner, strange, profane; specifically (active participle) to commit adultery
strange, in a variety of degrees and applications (foreign, non-relative, adulterous, different, wonderful)
to be smooth (figuratively); by implication (as smooth stones were used for lots) to apportion or separate

6.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
a house (in the greatest variation of applications, especially family, etc.)
in up to or over against; generally at, beside, among, behind, for, etc.
properly, to lean out (of a window), i.e. (by implication) peep or gaze (passively, be a spectacle)

7.brief: to see, literally or figuratively (in numerous applications, direct and implied, transitive, intransitive and causative)
to separate mentally (or distinguish), i.e.(generally) understand
a son (as a builder of the family name), in the widest sense (of literal and figurative relationship, including grandson, subject, nation, quality or condition, etc., (like father or brother), etc.)
(concretely) a boy (as active), from the age of infancy to adolescence; by implication, a servant; also (by interch. of sex), a girl (of similar latitude in age)
the heart; also used (figuratively) very widely for the feelings, the will and even the intellect; likewise for the centre of anything

8.brief: to cross over; used very widely of any transition (literal or figurative; transitive, intransitive, intensive, causative); specifically, to cover (in copulation)
an angle; by implication, a pinnacle; figuratively, a chieftain
a road (as trodden); figuratively, a course of life or mode of action, often adverb
a house (in the greatest variation of applications, especially family, etc.)
to pace, i.e. step regularly; (upward) to mount; (along) to march; (down and causatively) to hurl

9.brief: properly, a breeze, i.e. (by implication) dusk (when the evening breeze prevails)
a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)
the little man of the eye; the pupil or ball; hence, the middle (of night)
properly, a twist (away of the light), i.e. night; figuratively, adversity

10.brief: an encountering, accidental, friendly or hostile (also adverbially, opposite)

to commit adultery (usually of the female, and less often of simple fornication, rarely of involuntary ravishment); figuratively, to commit idolatry (the Jewish people being regarded as the spouse of Jehovah)
to guard, in a good sense (to protect, maintain, obey, etc.) or a bad one (to conceal, etc.)
the heart; also used (figuratively) very widely for the feelings, the will and even the intellect; likewise for the centre of anything

11.brief: to make a loud sound (like English 'hum'); by implication, to be in great commotion or tumult, to rage, war, moan, clamor

he (she or it); only expressed when emphatic or without a verb; also (intensively) self, or (especially with the article) the same; sometimes (as demonstrative) this or that; occasionally (instead of copula) as or are
to turn away, i.e. (morally) be refractory
a house (in the greatest variation of applications, especially family, etc.)
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to reside or permanently stay (literally or figuratively)
a foot (as used in walking); by implication, a step; by euphemistically the pudenda

12.brief: a stroke, literally or figuratively (in various applications, as follow)
properly, separate by awall, i.e. outside, outdoors
a stroke, literally or figuratively (in various applications, as follow)
a width, i.e. (concretely) avenue or area
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
an angle; by implication, a pinnacle; figuratively, a chieftain

13.brief: to fasten upon; hence, to seize, be strong (figuratively, courageous, causatively strengthen, cure, help, repair, fortify), obstinate; to bind, restrain, conquer
to kiss, literally or figuratively (touch); also (as a mode of attachment), to equip with weapons
the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)

14.brief: properly, a slaughter, i.e. the flesh of an animal; by implication, a sacrifice (the victim or the act)
properly, requital, i.e. a (voluntary) sacrifice in thanks
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)
to be safe (in mind, body or estate); figuratively, to be (causatively, make) completed; by implication, to be friendly; by extension, to reciprocate (in various applications)
a promise (to God); also (concretely) a thing promised

15.brief: above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
properly, set upright; hence (figuratively as adjective) just; but usually (as adverb or conjunction) rightly or so (in various applications to manner, time and relation; often with other particles)
to go (causatively, bring) out, in a great variety of applications, literally and figuratively, direct and proxim.
an encountering, accidental, friendly or hostile (also adverbially, opposite)
properly, to dawn, i.e. (figuratively) be (up) early at any task (with the implication of earnestness); by extension, to search for (with painstaking)
the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)
properly, to come forth to, i.e. appear or exist; transitively, to attain, i.e. find or acquire; figuratively, to occur, meet or be present

16.brief: properly, a carving; hence, a tapestry (as figured)
Mitsrajim, i.e. Upper and Lower Egypt

17.brief: to quiver (i.e. vibrate up and down, or rock to and fro); used in a great variety of applications (including sprinkling, beckoning, rubbing, bastinadoing, sawing, waving, etc.)
a bed (figuratively, a bier); abstractly, sleep; by euphemism, carnal intercourse
myrrh (as distilling in drops, and also as bitter)

18.brief: to walk (literally or figuratively); causatively, to carry (in various senses)
to slake the thirst (occasionally of other appetites)
(figuratively) to love; by implication, a love-token, lover, friend; specifically an uncle
as far (or long, or much) as, whether of space (even unto) or time (during, while, until) or degree (equally with)
properly, dawn (as the break of day); generally, morning
to leap for joy, i.e. exult, wave joyously
{affection (in a good or a bad sense)}

19.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
a non-entity; generally used as a negative particle
a man as an individual or a male person; often used as an adjunct to a more definite term (and in such cases frequently not expressed in translation)
a house (in the greatest variation of applications, especially family, etc.)
to walk (in a great variety of applications, literally and figuratively)
a road (as trodden); figuratively, a course of life or mode of action, often adverb
remote, literally or figuratively, of place or time; specifically, precious; often used adverbially (with preposition)

20.brief: a parcel (as packed up); also a kernel or particle (as if a package)
silver (from its pale color); by implication, money
to take (in the widest variety of applications)
a hand (the open one (indicating power, means, direction, etc.),
a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)
properly, fulness or the full moon, i.e. its festival
to go or come (in a wide variety of applications)
a house (in the greatest variation of applications, especially family, etc.)

21.brief: to stretch or spread out; by implication, to bend away (including moral deflection); used in a great variety of application
properly, something received, i.e. (mentally) instruction (whether on the part of the teacher or hearer); also (in an active and sinister sense) inveiglement
properly, smoothness (of the tongue); also an allotment
the lip (as a natural boundary); by implication, language; by analogy, a margin (of a vessel, water, cloth, etc.)
to push off; used in a great variety of applications, literally and figuratively (to expel, mislead, strike, inflict, etc.)

22.brief: to walk (in a great variety of applications, literally and figuratively)
properly, the hind part; generally used as an adverb or conjunction, after (in various senses)
near, with or among; often in general, to
properly, something slaughtered; hence, a beast (or meat, as butchered); abstractly butchery (or concretely, a place of slaughter)
to go or come (in a wide variety of applications)
near, with or among; often in general, to
properly, chastisement; figuratively, reproof, warning or instruction; also restraint

23.brief: as far (or long, or much) as, whether of space (even unto) or time (during, while, until) or degree (equally with)
to slice, i.e. break open or pierce
properly, a piercer, i.e. an arrow; by implication, a wound; figuratively, (of God) thunderbolt; the shaft of aspear
the liver (as the heaviest of the viscera)
properly, to be liquid or flow easily, i.e. (by implication); to hurry (in a good or a bad sense); often used (with another verb) adverbially, promptly
near, with or among; often in general, to
a (metallic) sheet (as pounded thin); also a spring net (as spread out like a lamina)
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles

to know (properly, to ascertain by seeing); used in a great variety of senses, figuratively, literally, euphemistically and inferentially (including observation, care, recognition; and causatively, instruction, designation, punishment, etc.)
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
properly, a breathing creature, i.e. animal of (abstractly) vitality; used very widely in a literal, accommodated or figurative sense (bodily or mental)

he (she or it); only expressed when emphatic or without a verb; also (intensively) self, or (especially with the article) the same; sometimes (as demonstrative) this or that; occasionally (instead of copula) as or are

24.brief: at this time, whether adverb, conjunction or expletive
a son (as a builder of the family name), in the widest sense (of literal and figurative relationship, including grandson, subject, nation, quality or condition, etc., (like father or brother), etc.)
to hear intelligently (often with implication of attention, obedience, etc.; causatively, to tell, etc.)
to prick up the ears, i.e. hearken
the mouth (as the means of blowing), whether literal or figurative (particularly speech); specifically edge, portion or side; adverbially (with preposition) according to

25.brief: not (the qualified negation, used as a deprecative); once (Job 24:25) as a noun, nothing
near, with or among; often in general, to
a road (as trodden); figuratively, a course of life or mode of action, often adverb
the heart; also used (figuratively) very widely for the feelings, the will and even the intellect; likewise for the centre of anything
not (the qualified negation, used as a deprecative); once (Job 24:25) as a noun, nothing
to vacillate, i.e. reel or stray (literally or figuratively); also causative of both

26.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
abundant (in quantity, size, age, number, rank, quality)
to fall, in a great variety of applications (intransitive or causative, literal or figurative)
powerful (specifically, a paw); by implication, numerous
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)

27.brief: a road (as trodden); figuratively, a course of life or mode of action, often adverb
Hades or the world of the dead (as if a subterranean retreat), including its accessories and inmates
a house (in the greatest variation of applications, especially family, etc.)

to descend (literally, to go downwards; or conventionally to a lower region, as the shore, a boundary, the enemy, etc.; or figuratively, to fall); causatively, to bring down (in all the above applications)
near, with or among; often in general, to
death (natural or violent); concretely, the dead, their place or state (hades); figuratively, pestilence, ruin
